history.content:
By now many of us had hoped it would be common knowledge that all freshmen students with interests in our department should be taking EE16A and EE16B rather than taking Math 54. Somehow, this message seems to be getting blocked or somehow attenuated. It really is something that students need to help disseminate. There is a very good reason why EE16AB are required, and Math 54 is not. 

In terms of your specific question, the easy answer is take EE16A. If you already know something, it will be ridiculously easy to do that problem on the homework and there is no loss from you doing that problem. If it takes you more than 15 minutes to do a HW problem, then you clearly don't understand it and benefit from doing it. The course is not curved so you are not being unfair to anyone.  

Another thing to do is just tune into EE16A lectures starting from last week. Come to the last couple of lectures. Can you understand what is going on and follow along? This might be an indication.

I am currently a freshman (CS-intended) who enrolled in Math 53 for Spring 2018.  I am currently taking Math 54 this fall semester and I am thinking of dropping Math 53 for EE16A but I am unsure if seats are still open for students in my position. I was wondering if in this case it would be a better idea to enroll in EECS 47D, considering that I will already have gotten an understanding of linear algebra from Math 54 by then?
history.subject: EE 16A vs. EECS 47D
